description: Facts and certain transport-related documents about the London Borough of Barnet

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["We partner with Barnet to implement the Mayor's Transport Strategy in the borough."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Your Local Implementation Plan (LIP)"}

The Local Implementation Plans (LIP) is produced by the London Borough of Barnet and agreed with us. It details transport infrastructure changes in a three year period to support the Mayor's Transport Strategy .
Find out more about LIP funding.

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) allocation 2019/20","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/barnet-2019-20-lip-allocation-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 220KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2017/18 - Borough Leader","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/1718-lip-confirmation-leader-letter-barnet.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 74KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2016/17","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/lip-funding-confirmation-letters-16-17-barnet.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 75KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) delivery plan letter","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/barnet-lip-delivery-plan-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 70KB","image":{}},{"title":"Public Transport Access Levels - Barnet","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/public-transport-access-levels-barnet.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 2.92MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"LIP targets for Barnet"}
Each borough has set targets in their LIP against the Mayor's Transport Strategy outcomes - we track and report on progress against these targets in the LIP3 MTS outcomes borough data pack .
For example, the car ownership in the borough was 147,703 in 2017. The LIP target to reduce car ownership by 2021 is 145,800.
Residents in Barnet made an average of 853,000 trips each day between 2015 and 2018 by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Car and motorcycle: 45%","Tube/DLR: 10%","National Rail and London Overground: 2%","Bus: 13%","Taxi/Other: 1%","Cycle: 1%","Walking: 28%"]}
We also work with boroughs to encourage more cycling . We recorded 5,969 daily cycle trips on average starting in Barnet between 2015 and 2018.
More resident and visitor population figures are on the GLA website.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Funding in your borough"}
We provide funding to boroughs and local communities for transport improvements in your local area.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Vision Zero in your borough"}

We are working with boroughs to reduce the number of deaths and serious injuries from all road collisions to zero by 2041. They are responsible for enforcing safe speeds on their roads, as well as leading community programmes to encourage using roads safely. Find out more about Vision Zero .
In 2017 there were 148 individuals killed or seriously injured in Barnet. Our target for 2022 is to reduce this number to 84.
Find out more about collisions in your borough.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What we're working on in Barnet"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["We consult local communities on a range of projects every year - \u003ca href=\"https://consultations.tfl.gov.uk/consultation_finder/?advanced=1\u0026st=open\"\u003esearch on the TfL Consultation Hub\u003c/a\u003e ","Find out about \u003ca href=\"/status-updates/major-works-and-events\"\u003emajor works and events near you\u003c/a\u003e ","See some ongoing TfL \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/travel-information/improvements-and-projects/?Borough=Barnet\"\u003eimprovements and projects in or near Barnet\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Work now going on in your borough includes:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eColindale - \u003c/strong\u003e a new station building with step-free access and new pedestrian and cycle links will help to support around 10,000 new homes planned in the area","\u003cstrong\u003eBurnt Oak\u003c/strong\u003e - step-free access complete in 2020","\u003cstrong\u003eHealthy High Streets\u003c/strong\u003e - as part of the \u003ca href=\"/corporate/about-tfl/how-we-work/planning-for-the-future/healthy-streets\"\u003eHealthy Streets initiative\u003c/a\u003e , we will install new decorative \"Welcome to Hendon\" signage, cycle parking, new trees and refreshed planters around Hendon Central Tube station"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Bus network changes"}
From time to time - after consulting the public - we alter bus routes to reflect changing patterns in demand. We also make temporary changes, often because of road works. See the latest bus changes.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ)"}
To improve air quality the ULEZ will extend to parts of Barnet from October 2021 .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Our assets in Barnet"}
Assets we maintain in your borough include:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["13 Tube stations","Around 855 bus stops - \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/maps_/bus-spider-maps?Query=Barnet\"\u003esee all 69 bus day routes in Barnet\u003c/a\u003e ","Three bus stations and Edgware bus garage","Three coach stops","Two taxi ranks","Around 210 traffic signals","Over 32 kilometres of \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/modes/driving/red-routes/red-route-maps\"\u003ered routes\u003c/a\u003e "]}
See a map of our assets in London.
We maintain our assets until they need to be renewed or disposed of as set out in our asset management plan. We do this by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Servicing them regularly to keep them operational","Repairing or replacing faulty assets"]}
Report a problem on a London street with our Streetcare tool .
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"We do not maintain in Barnet:"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Non-red route roads - these roads are maintained by \u003ca href=\"https://www.barnet.gov.uk/\"\u003eBarnet\u003c/a\u003e ","Litter removal on red routes - this is also the borough's responsibility","Network Rail track at London Overground stations - \u003ca href=\"https://www.networkrail.co.uk/communities/contact-us/\"\u003econtact Network Rail\u003c/a\u003e ","Taxis and mini cabs - these are owned by \u003ca href=\"/modes/taxis-and-minicabs/what-to-expect-from-your-journey\"\u003etaxi drivers and minicab offices \u003c/a\u003e ","One bus garage in Barnet that is \u003ca href=\"/modes/buses/who-runs-your-bus\"\u003eowned and managed by a bus company\u003c/a\u003e ","Coaches"," \u003ca href=\"/info-for/taxis-and-private-hire/taxi-ranks\"\u003eTaxi ranks\u003c/a\u003e on borough roads. Cars and other vehicles parked on taxi ranks can be \u003ca href=\"https://www.barnet.gov.uk/parking\"\u003ereported to Barnet\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Report private hire vehicles (PHVs) parked on ranks or unattended taxis on ranks directly to us.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Dealing with severe weather"}
For documents relating to winter service in the boroughs, go to the Streets publications page .
